0BB7D9600C104CABA4046A1E25D4A91D.description: Explain the responsibility of a business owner to employ individuals with various levels of training (e.g., apprentice, Red Seal or non-certified) and to provide quality customer service.

F44FEA813A2642078243ECC9B0DD2194.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

4F83D7C35DE940B587A5E573658D2FDA.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

8279FE040EFC41718FEF929E4E76CCCB.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

53E04814E5BA4CB08AAC45E679F20D1B.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

D1AFA8D4443347F3977A4447FC0C6305.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

421BCA9F84284C44A93FC7E272D1F043.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

42445A942D2141B0BF2056CBFD1DEB6E.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

87681AFA57F94E18A23EFF2F3E3ECDA3.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

A7461B7A60DC466397E59385D32D54FE.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

CA6E468248B741E09029D016242FB101.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

A8518219560849658E034FEB301C7F48.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

C145EDF661274A1EB5E90DE044CE2847.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

F1C912A915EF435C8BF2FF299C1394A5.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

BE64631A42FF47C391C17624976C03F8.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

BE4D5794833D422FADAFD420C4E579E4.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

EC41C4BDDDD24DDA9F0ABA78FD572BC9.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

6473854C5EB843B29D45EAC1988C0386.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

2630B6C90A31457DADCA3D62B3A68108.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

A0AF088490B5497FA2F4A991969213EE.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.
